channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After offering buyouts to air traffic controllers, Trump’s administration says they’re exempt from ‘early retirement’ following deadly plane crashes
item.description: January’s tragedies reignited concern on the impact of air traffic controller shortages on aviation safety.

item.title: Hims & Hers Super Bowl ad slams pricey pharma industry—and fumbles FDA warnings on compounded GLP-1 drugs
item.description: Taking a compounded GLP-1 medication isn’t the same thing as your pharmacy filling the cheaper, generic version of the drug your doctor prescribed.

item.title: Rubio Visits Panama Canal
item.description: On his first foreign trip as secretary of state, Marco Rubio met with President José Raúl Mulino and visited the Panama Canal.

item.title: A Presidency That’s Off the Rails. It Took Only Two Weeks.
item.description: But we’ve underestimated Trump’s political strength many times before.

item.title: Crews Lift Wreckage From D.C. Plane Crash Out of Potomac
item.description: A crane was removing the fuselage of the American Airlines jet, which crashed into the river last week after colliding with a U.S. Army helicopter.

item.title: Illegal N.Y.P.D. Stop-and-Frisk Tactics Continue Unchecked, Monitor Says
item.description: Anti-crime units are still stopping and frisking too many people unlawfully, according to a new report that comes months before a mayoral election in ...

item.title: Giving Elon Musk’s DOGE access to the Treasury payment system risks a U.S. debt default and global financial crisis, senator warns
item.description: The Treasury Department's payment system has been likened to the government's checkbook and makes $6 trillion in disbursements a year.

item.title: Chappell Roan used her Grammy speech to advocate for health care and a living wage
item.description: The Best New Artist winner called out “the most powerful people in music” on the industry’s biggest night.

item.title: He Went to Jail for Stealing Someone’s Identity. But It Was His All Along.
item.description: A decades-long theft of a man’s identity raised questions about who gets believed in the justice system, and what happens when your name is taken.

item.title: French Court Convicts Director Christophe Ruggia in #MeToo Case
item.description: Christophe Ruggia was sentenced to four years and fined for sexually assaulting the actress Adèle Haenel when she was a minor.

item.title: I had a VC-funded unicorn-in-the-making and I messed it up—here’s how
item.description: I was humiliated. I had nothing but success in my previous ventures, and this was a very public failure. Now I barely remember it.

item.title: French Court Convicts Director Christophe Ruggia in #MeToo Case
item.description: Christophe Ruggia was sentenced to four years and fined for sexually assaulting the actress Adèle Haenel when she was a minor.

item.title: With Trump’s Backing Uncertain, Europe Scrambles to Shore Up Its Own Defenses
item.description: European leaders will gather Monday to plot a rough path forward on defense. Wavering support from President Trump is likely to drive the debate.

item.title: Crews Lift Wreckage From D.C. Plane Crash Out of Potomac
item.description: A crane was removing the fuselage of the American Airlines jet, which crashed into the river last week after colliding with a U.S. Army helicopter.

item.title: How Costs for Online Sales After Trump’s Trade Move
item.description: President Trump’s tariff measures included a significant change to trade rules that could increase costs for many products bought online, including on...
